intro: Haplopappus sphacelatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. Haplopappus sphacelatus is adapted to withstand drought and is considered a hardy, resilient species.
